result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley L Martinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Edward S B, III or individuals who use or sell drugs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Christopher Glinski.  Clerk K. Zirbel/M. Herr.  Cash bond ($5,000.00 posted) was ordered revoked on 8/22/16.  State's motion to forfeit the $5,000.00 cash bond is withdrawn by the State.  Per order of the Court, cash bond to be returned to poster.  Sentencing arguments made by counsel.  Defendant is sentenced to 5 years in the WSP; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 4 years of Extended Supervision.  Credit for 181 days.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Court costs & DNA surcharge ordered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Amended

*** BOND REVOKED ***
940.02(2)(a) - 1st Degree Reckless Homicide, PTAC

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody re 16CF900) with Atty Christopher Glinski.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Amended Information filed charging 2nd degree reckless homicide/deliver drugs, PTAC.  Plea of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 10/11/16 at 4:00.  $5,000.00 cash bond that is posted is revoked/no bond allowed.  Cash to be held pending sentencing hearing on 10/11/16.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Johnson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Motion hearing is delayed, STC set over to 8/22/16 at 1:15pm to allow deft time to consider the State's offer.  Bond continued.
to forfeit bond; filed by ADA C McNeill.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Glinski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Glinski states there may be an other acts motion.  MH set for 8/17/16 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.

With ADA McNeill, Atty Glinski and by approval of the court, the JS of 6/27/16 at 8:30am is rescheduled, due to a congested trial calendar; reset to 8/29/16 at 8:30am and JSH set for 8/11/16 at 1:15pm.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Glinksi.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Rose's motion to sever in co-deft case.  ADA McNeill states no objection to motion.  Court grants motion to sever case from 15CF851.  ADA McNeill requests to adjourn trial as the ME is unavailable the week of 2/22/16.  Court grants adjournment of trial from 2/22/16 at 8:30am to 6/27/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
and demand for discovery; filed by ADA Carli McNeill.

Atty Glinski states he has been in discussions w/ADA McNeill to attempt to resolve the case.  FPT set for 12/1/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Defendant Ashley L Martinson appeared with Attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution. Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued. Parties waive DA PTC.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:45 am.
